lines.text:
[to Joel]
Langner tells me that you've worked on some cases of stolen books... that you've helped the insurance companies quite a bit.
Any favors he does we pay him for. There's not an altruistic bone in his body.
Anything you want to know about my husband's bones, Lieutenant, you can ask me.
You know, this thing's apt to blow the whole rare book business sky high. Play ball with me, Miss Thome. The explosion won't singe a hair of your very pretty head. I want to be on your team.

[Flirtatiously]
When do we play the next game?
Pardon me, but do you take dope?
Oh, no, you're on the wrong track, Lieutenant. I killed Brockler myself. I waved a $10 dollar bill over his head, and he broke his neck jumping for it.
All right, if you want to find Brockler's murderer, ask Brockler. Offer a reward. He'll talk dead or alive.
The world laughed in my face.
You've got a great face to laugh into.

[Walking into the office and seeing the Sloanes kissing]
Oh, pardon me. I thought this was a business office.

[Speaking of Morgan]
He told me about your kindness to him yesterday.
Only three people know about this.
Yesterday it was only two people.

[to Joel]
You're in the doghouse, my boy, and only a very good story will open the door.
